benchmark_details.name: Sepedi monolingual (SepMono) dataset and Sepedi radio news (SepNews) dataset
benchmark_details.overview: This study curates two new datasets, the Sepedi monolingual dataset (SepMono) and the Sepedi radio news dataset (SepNews), to train transformer-based language models for the Sepedi language, focusing on the impact of occlusion-based training techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To analyze the implications of pre-training a Sepedi generative pre-trained model when only a relatively small dataset is available, specifically for text generation.

data.source: The SepMono dataset consists of various South African resources and the SepNews dataset is derived from radio news broadcasts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics of validation loss and perplexity are calculated as per standard definitions; BLEU score compares generated text to reference text.
methodology.interpretation: Lower validation loss and perplexity indicate better performance, while higher BLEU scores indicate higher quality of generated text.
methodology.validation: The datasets were partitioned into training, validation, and testing sets, with performance tracked during training.
